title: Cheese and bacon hedgehog

ingredients.content: 2 - 3 spring onions/shallots, trimmed and cut into pieces
100 g bacon, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
250 g cream cheese, cut into pieces (see Tips)

preparations.content: Place spring onions/shallots and bacon into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil and cook <b>4 min/100°C//speed 1<b>, <b>without measuring cup<b>. Set aside to cool completely in mixing bowl (approx. 10 minutes).
Add cream cheese, mayonnaise and Worcestershire sauce and mix <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer onto a large piece of plastic wrap and shape into a wedge. Cover and transfer into refrigerator overnight.
Remove from refrigerator and transfer onto a serving platter. Wearing gloves or using a large piece of plastic wrap, shape into a domed teardrop shape and smooth surface with a spoon.
Score face (pointed end) of hedgehog with horizontal lines. Cut a tip off of the olive for the nose and cut 2 slices for the eyes and insert into hedgehogs' face.

Arrange crackers in an alternating pattern from front to back, sticking up out of his back, to form the quills (see Tips). Serve immediately or cover with plastic wrap and place into refrigerator until ready to serve.

hintsAndTricks: A firm, good quality cream cheese works best for this recipe.
To make your own rice crackers, please refer to the Crunchy rice cracker recipe on this recipe chip. Alternatively, you can use other types of snacks (such as pretzels or melba toasts) to decorate.
Crackers will soften once placed into hedgehog, so we recommend assembling no more than 1 hour in advance.
